intro: Peucedanum officinale subsp. brachyradium, commonly known as narrow-leaved hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter, narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Peucedanum officinale.
